official_title: A bill to provide that salary adjustments for Members of Congress shall be payable only when the total receipts of the United States Government exceed the total outlays during the fiscal year.
short_title: Federal Debt Reduction Incentive Profit Sharing Pay Raise Commission Reform Act of 1979

summary.text: Federal Debt Reduction Incentive - Profit Sharing - Pay Raise Commission Reform Act of 1979 - Provides that salaries of Members of Congress shall be $42,500 per year plus a commission of $1,000 a year for each $1,000,000,000 of Federal annual budget surplus applied to retirement of the national debt during the preceding fiscal year. Stipulates that such annual salary shall not exceed $48,825. Establishes a ceiling on annual salaries of the Speaker and floor leaders of $70,000 and $60,000, respectively.
